summary: sir bradley wiggins will bid for cycling 's hour record on june 7 at london 's olympic velodrome . the four-time olympic champion and 2012 tour de france winner , who is 35 on april 28 , will attempt to add to his accomplishments by riding the furthest distance in 60 minutes at the lee valley velopark . ` the hour record is a holy grail for cyclists , ' wiggins said .

explain: Sir Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion and 2012 Tour de France winner, is set to bid for cycling's hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome. This will be a significant achievement in his career, as he aims to add to his accomplishments by breaking the existing distance record in 60 minutes. Cyclists consider the hour record as a holy grail, highlighting its significant achievement within the sport.
Sir Bradley Wiggins is a well-accomplished cyclist with four Olympic championships and a win in the 2012 Tour de France, retiring from his Team Sky career on April 28.
Sir Bradley Wiggins targets to achieve a significant achievement in cycling by aiming to ride the farthest distance in an hour at the Lee Valley VeloPark, adding to his previous accomplishments.
